titles.ja: 冬の田舎！女子ふたり旅

descriptions.ja:
冬の山形楽しもう！樹氷と雪原スノーモービル 台湾の人は雪に対する憧れが強い。雪は山形の最強の武器。有名な蔵王の樹氷は 自然の造形美。しびれるような厳しい寒さの中の蔵王の樹氷めぐり。いろんな形のスノーモンスター達に出会えます。雪原を爽快に駆けるスノーモービルは雪の無い南国台湾の人々にとって究極の雪の楽しみ方なのだ。雪中イチゴ狩りも人気
のイベント。真冬でもフルーツ！「外は一面の銀世界でも、観光イチゴ園のハウスの中は甘～いイチゴの香りでいっぱい！
descriptions.en:
The Taiwanese have a deep adoration for snow. Not so coincidentally, snow is also Yamagata's greatest asset. Its juhyo (or ice monsters) of Zao are nature's works of art. Our hosts brave the harsh cold to visit the diversely shaped snow sculptures. Yamagata's snow also allows one the exhilarating experience of zipping through fields of snow on snow mobiles. For the Taiwanese, it's the ultimate snow experience. Sweet, 
fragrant fruits are also aplenty here even in the dead of winter. One can take a break from the snowy outdoors for some fruit picking in Yamagata's strawberry farms.

titles.ja: 晩秋の田舎！女子ふたり旅

descriptions.ja: 果物王国である山形の晩秋は、台湾人大好きなリンゴやラ・フランスの季節。果物狩りや最上川舟下りを楽しみながら温泉を巡る。台湾で人気のツアーの一つが、日本の田舎体験。飯豊町では、ここ数年台湾からの観光客を誘致し成功している。田舎町「熱烈歓迎」雪遊びツアーが定着し、次なる活性化策は「農家民宿」。受け入れ人数は限られるが、満足度は非常に高く、12年11月には台湾の旅行コンテストの日本・韓国部門で最高賞に輝いたほど。田舎風景の飯豊町で、農業体験に挑戦する。旅の締めに、山形の名所「山寺」を訪ね秋の名物「芋煮」や「玉こんにゃく」「キノコ料理」などを味わう。
descriptions.en:
Yamagata is known as the land of fruits and hot springs. In late autumn, Taiwanese favourites like apples and La France pears come into season. It is also the perfect season for fruit picking, hot springs, and a cruise down Mogami River. Top among the Taiwanese however is Yamagata’s countryside experience. Following the steady popularity of snow activities are farm-stays that support regional rejuvenation. Iide town especially has succeeded in drawing Taiwanese travellers in the recent years. While it's not an activity that can accommodate large numbers, many leave satisfied. In November 2012, these farm-stays came in top in the Japan/Korea category of a travel contest held in Taiwan. Our hosts 
set out to Iide to enjoy the rural scenery and the novelty of farm 
experience. They conclude their journey by visiting Yamadera and 
savouring seasonal dishes like imoni (stewed yam), tama konnyaku (konjac balls) and kinoko ryori (seasonal mushrooms).
